snippet: Two weeks after the United States and Turkey announced the plan, it is unclear which forces will fight the jihadists and what support they will receive.
abstract: Details of agreement between United States and Turkey to push Islamic State extremists out of Syrian territory along Turkish border are still unclear two weeks after announcement; Syrian rebels remain skeptical that US and its allies will give necessary support to topple government of Pres Bashar al-Assad, but some have expressed cautious optimism about aid in fight against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after the United States and Turkey announced the plan, it is unclear which forces will fight the jihadists and what support they will receive.

headline.main: U.S. and Turkey Face Questions in Anti-ISIS Effort
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Turkey Face Questions in Anti-ISIS Effort
